Peter Szabo

Hello, my name is Peter! In 2019 I graduated my B.Sc with a hounorous degree in Molecular Bionics. I have just finished one year ago a triple degree Master Program in Image Processing and Computer Vision. Since then I am working as a Deep Learning Engineer working at Continental, developing computer vision based driving solutions. I consider myself a hardworking and ambitious individual, with great passion to grow and learn. I have strong technical skills as well as great interpersonal ability. I am very keen in different fields Computer Vision, in which I have more than 3 years of experience, my main field of interest is Deep Learning related Computer Vision technologies.

CV

Experience

Deep Learning Engineer

Continental

In the automoitve industry developing camera based driving solutions using deep learning./p>

October 2021 - Present

Research intern

Vicomtech (Applied Research Center)

Development of master thesis project called: Enhancing 360° VR Experiences with Machine Learning-based Multisensorial Effects

The objective is the design of a novel solution for enhancing 360° video applications with multisensorial devices, including the design of machine-learning algorithms that identify content on screen and trigger multisensorial effects. The solution will be deployed in a prototype system, in which multisensorial devices: haptic and olfaction will be triggered by an algorithm that must select and execute the most suitable effects to the content displayed on video. In 360° videos, effects are activated according to the content the video is displaying. For this, convolutional neural networks will be used for image processing, detection of the cues, that could trigger the effects. Contextual data is also important: based on user behavior/preferences, the intensity of effects should be adapted.

Vicomtech is a non-profit research institute. My work was in collaboration with Dublin City University (DCU).

Java EE full stack development project on digitizing the Hungarian Adoption System. My responsibility was to implement processes on both front and back end.

SZTAKI (Institute for Computer Science and Control)

Projects

Enhancing 360° VR Experiences with Machine Learning based Multisensorial Effects

January 2021 - Present

Master thesis about designing novel solutions for automatic mulsemedia (olfactory and haptic) content generation on 360° video. The work included content recognition on 360° video using Deep Learning technologies, designing a prototype (recognition and delivery) and evaluation on my custom 360° scent dataset. The parts of the prototype can be seen on the image (Oculus Quest 2, Haptic mouse, scent machine) The prototype and the dataset is publicly available on Github (with a tutorial included, by clicking on the title of this paragraph). The work received an 9.5/10 mark in UAM being the highest in my cohort at UAM. Currently, it is under the process for publication.

Corona Killer AR

September 2020 - January 2021

Interactive AR application developed in Unity for Microsoft Hololens, more information about the project in the report.. The work included scanning of the environemnt, generation of virtual object in the space, gesture recognition, GUI design etc.

FaceQNet

January 2020 - January 2021

FaceQNet is quality assessment system for Face Recognition based on Deep Learning provided by Julian Fierrez programmed in tensorflow

We explored the impact of masks on the performance of state-of-the-art face quality assessment system, called FaceQNet. We explored solutions to enhance the performance and evaluated its performance in several challenging scenarios (different brightness, motion or resolution). We discovered the impact of different facial mask types (surgical, cloth mask, KN95, N95) and evaluated the impact of the different mask coverage using synthetized mask images. We proved that our system works robustly with face masks, and by only slightly lowering the mask its performance almost matches the no mask performance. This fining is crucial in COVID-19, when lowering the mask is more feasible than completly removing it. Finally, we compared our results with other state-of-the-art face quality assessment system, such as SER-FIQ on both VGG and LFW dataset, using ERC curve and histogram.

3D Reconstruction of a Scene Through Multiple Images

June 2019 - January 2020

Creation of a 3D reconstruction pipeline: obtaining intrinsic parameters of a camera, extracting and matching feature points, and 3D reconstruction in MATLAB

My report achieved the highest score in the cohort.

Object Detection and Tracking

January 2020 - May 2020

Implementation various object tracking method such as Kalman filter and Histogram based object tracker in C++ and OpenCV.

Three Dimensional Reconstruction of the Hepatic Vessels

June 2019 - January 2020

Participating in a medical image processing project as a part of zMed. Responsible for the design and creation of the 3D reconstruction and labeling of the hepatic vessel structure based on CT images of the liver using traditional image processing technologies. After the reconstruction of the haptic vessel network, the labeling of the vessels is done using prior knowledge about the orientation width and other biological features.

Interests

In my free time I am fond doing all kind of sports. I am playing waterpolo for 4 years now, my current team is the Semmeweis University Waterpolo Club. In winters I am an avid skier, during the warmer months I enjoy hiking.

When I want to take a break from the screen, I like working with wood. I was learning carpentry from 2019-2020 at Kaesz Gyula Faipari Technikum és Szakképző Iskola (hungarian) , a high ranking school in carpentry, one of their student achieving the first place at Carpentry World Championship in 2019. During that 1 year of working I learned how to process wood, using different machines, and various techniques to create something wonderful from wood. Some of my projects can be seen on the slideshow at the right.

    The program aims to help students in their research life and provide them extra opportunities for their studies, as well as supporting them to get involved in the scientific community. The best 5% of students are selected and invited from the faculty.
